# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(str::AbstractString, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(str)
    output = ""
    for word in words
        if length(output) + length(word) + 1 > text_width  # Add 1 for the space between words
            output += "\n"
        end
        output *= "$(word)"
        output *= " "
        # If we reached the end of a line without exceeding the text width, add a new line character
        if length(output) >= text_width && length(str) > length(output)
            output += "\n"  # Start a new line if we are at the end of a word and not yet at the text width
        end
    end
    return output
end
```

Example usage:
```julia
julia> wrap_string("Hello world! This is a very long sentence that I need to wrap.")
"Hello world!\nThis is a very long\nsentence that I need to wrap."
```
